    "can_group": false,
    "locked_for_user": false,
    "message": "Dear MATH201 students,\n\nThis is to announce that the open book exam for Advanced Mathematics will be held on:\n\nğŸ“… Date: January 20, 2025\nâ° Time: 9:00 AM - 11:30 AM\nâ±ï¸ Duration: 150 minutes\nğŸ“ Location: Building B Room 301\n\nNote: This is an OPEN BOOK exam. You may bring your textbooks and notes.\n\nPlease arrive 15 minutes before the exam time. Bring your student ID and necessary writing materials.\n\nGood luck!\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",
    "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
  },

    "pinned": false,
    "group_category_id": null,
    "can_group": false,
    "locked_for_user": false,
    "message": "Dear MATH201-3 students,\n\nğŸ“Š Individual Research Project Announced!\n\nğŸ“… Due Date: December 12, 2024\nğŸ“Š Weight: 20% of final grade\n\nğŸ¯ Project Requirements:\n- Choose a mathematical topic related to course material\n- Write a 8-10 page research paper\n- Include mathematical proofs or applications\n- Present findings to the class (10 minutes)\n\nğŸ“‹ Suggested Topics:\n- Applications of linear algebra in computer graphics\n- Mathematical modeling in real-world problems\n- Historical development of key theorems\n- Computational methods and algorithms\n\nğŸ“… Timeline:\n- Topic selection: November 15, 2024\n- Outline submission: November 25, 2024\n- Draft for peer review: December 5, 2024\n- Final submission: December 12, 2024\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",
    "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
  },

    "pinned": false,

    "can_group": false,
    "locked_for_user": false,
    "message": "Dear MATH201-3 students,\n\nğŸ“… Midterm Exam Schedule:\n\nğŸ“… Date: November 12, 2024\nâ° Time: Regular class time\nâ±ï¸ Duration: 75 minutes\nğŸ“ Location: Regular classroom\n\nğŸ“š Exam Coverage:\n- Chapters 1-6 from textbook\n- All lecture materials through Week 8\n- Homework assignments 1-4\n\nğŸ“ Format:\n- Multiple choice (40%)\n- Short answer questions (35%)\n- Problem solving (25%)\n\nğŸ’¡ Study Tips:\n- Review lecture slides and notes\n- Practice problems from homework\n- Attend review session on November 10\n\nGood luck with your preparation!\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",
    "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
  },

    "can_group": false,
    "locked_for_user": false,
    "message": "Dear MATH201-3 students,\n\nğŸ“ Problem Set 1 has been posted and is available under Assignments.\n\nğŸ“… Due Date: October 12, 2024, 11:59 PM\nğŸ“Š Weight: 12% of final grade\nâ±ï¸ Estimated Time: 6-8 hours\n\nğŸ“‹ Assignment Details:\n- 8 problems covering chapters 1-3\n- Show all work for full credit\n- Handwritten solutions are acceptable\n- Scan and upload as PDF if handwritten\n\nğŸ’¡ Tips:\n- Start early - some problems are challenging\n- Attend office hours if you need help\n- Form study groups (but submit individual work)\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",
    "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
  },

    "message": "Dear MATH201-3 students,\n\nWelcome to Advanced Mathematics-3! I'm excited to have you in this course.\n\nğŸ« Course Information:\nğŸ“ Credits: 4\nğŸ“ Exam Type: Open Book\n\nğŸ“š Course Materials:\n- Please check the syllabus for required textbooks\n- All lecture slides will be posted on Canvas\n- Office hours: Tuesdays and Thursdays 2:00-4:00 PM\n\nğŸ’¡ Important Notes:\n- Please introduce yourself in the discussion forum\n- Check your email regularly for course updates\n- Don't hesitate to ask questions!\n\nLooking forward to a great semester!\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",
    "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
  },

    "message": "Dear MATH201-3 students,\n\nğŸ“Š Individual Research Project Announced!\n\nğŸ“… Due Date: December 12, 2024\nğŸ“Š Weight: 20% of final grade\n\nğŸ¯ Project Requirements:\n- Choose a mathematical topic related to course material\n- Write a 8-10 page research paper\n- Include mathematical proofs or applications\n- Present findings to the class (10 minutes)\n\nğŸ“‹ Suggested Topics:\n- Applications of linear algebra in computer graphics\n- Mathematical modeling in real-world problems\n- Historical development of key theorems\n- Computational methods and algorithms\n\nğŸ“… Timeline:\n- Topic selection: November 15, 2024\n- Outline submission: November 25, 2024\n- Draft for peer review: December 5, 2024\n- Final submission: December 12, 2024\n\nBest regards,\nCourse Instructor",
    "subscription_hold": "topic_is_announcement"
